pytket.device¶

The device module provides access to the \(\mathrm{t|ket}\rangle\) Device structure and methods for providing gate errors amongst other device information. This module is provided in binary form during the PyPI installation.

class pytket.device.Device¶

The base device class, describing gate errors and other device information for qubits and edges.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: pytket.device.Device, node_errors: Dict[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.device.GateErrorContainer], edge_errors: Dict[Tuple[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.circuit.UnitID], pytket.device.GateErrorContainer], architecture: pytket.routing.Architecture) -> None

The constructor for a device with gate errors and timing information for qubits and connections of the device.

Parameters

  • node_errors – A map from node ids to gate errors and timings

  • edge_errors – A map from edges (ordered pairs of node ids) to gate errors and timings

  • architecture – An architecture containing qubit connectivity information

  1. __init__(self: pytket.device.Device, architecture: pytket.routing.Architecture) -> None

Construct a device from a connectivity graph with no gate information.

Parameters

architecture – An architecture containing qubit connectivity information

get_average_error(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. get_average_error(self: pytket.device.Device, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) -> Optional[float]

Returns averaged error for all single qubit primitives for Node.

Parameters

node – Node gate error is averaged for

  1. get_average_error(self: pytket.device.Device, edge: Tuple[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.circuit.UnitID]) -> Optional[float]

Returns averaged error for all multi qubit primitives for Edge.

Parameters

edge – Edge gate error is averaged for

get_coupling(self: pytket.device.Device) → List[Tuple[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.circuit.UnitID]]¶

Returns the coupling map of the Device as UnitIDs.

get_error(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. get_error(self: pytket.device.Device, gate: pytket.circuit.OpType, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) -> float

Returns stored error for given OpType and Node.

Parameters

  • gate – OpType (gate) of error to be found

  • node – Node gate is ran on

  1. get_error(self: pytket.device.Device, gate: pytket.circuit.OpType, edge: Tuple[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.circuit.UnitID]) -> float

Returns stored error for given OpType and Node.

Parameters

  • gate – OpType (gate) of error to be found

  • edge – Edge gate is ran on

get_frequency(self: pytket.device.Device, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) → Optional[float]¶

Returns stored frequency for given Node.

:param node frequency is found for

get_gate_time(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. get_gate_time(self: pytket.device.Device, gate: pytket.circuit.OpType, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) -> float

Returns stored gate execution time for given OpType and Node.

Parameters

  • OpType – gate (gate) of execution time to be found

  • node – Node gate is ran on

  1. get_gate_time(self: pytket.device.Device, gate: pytket.circuit.OpType, edge: Tuple[pytket.circuit.UnitID, pytket.circuit.UnitID]) -> float

Returns stored gate execution time for given OpType and Node.

Parameters

  • OpType – gate (gate) of execution time to be found

  • edge – Edge gate is ran on

get_nodes(self: pytket.device.Device) → List[pytket.circuit.UnitID]¶

Returns a vector of all nodes of Device.

get_readout_error(self: pytket.device.Device, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) → Optional[float]¶

Returns stored readout error for given Node.

:param node readout error is found for

get_t1_time(self: pytket.device.Device, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) → Optional[float]¶

Returns stored t1 time for given Node.

:param node t1 time is found for

get_t2_time(self: pytket.device.Device, node: pytket.circuit.UnitID) → Optional[float]¶

Returns stored t2 time for given Node.

:param node t2 time is found for

property architecture¶

The underlying connectivity graph of the device

class pytket.device.GateError¶

Container for error rate and time of a single gate.

__init__(self: pytket.device.GateError, error: float, time: float) → None¶

Constructor for a struct containing gate error rate and run time for a single gate.

Parameters

  • error – Error rate of gate, in range [0,1]

  • time – Duration of gate in nanoseconds

class pytket.device.GateErrorContainer¶

Container for gate errors for a single node or edge, contains a map between supported gate types and a struct containing information on error and time.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer) -> None

Constructs a GateErrorContainer with no entries.

  1. __init__(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, gate_error_map: Dict[pytket.circuit.OpType, pytket.device.GateError]) -> None

The constructor for a class containing all gate errors and runtimes for a given node or edge.

Parameters

gate_error_map – Map from OpType to its associated GateError, describing error and duration

add_error(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, new_error: Tuple[pytket.circuit.OpType, pytket.device.GateError]) → None¶

Adds a new error to container.

Parameters

new_error – A pair of an OpType and its associated GateError

add_frequency(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, frequency: float) → None¶

Adds a frequency for this node.

Parameters

frequency – Frequency of the node in GHz

add_readout(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, readout_error: float) → None¶

Adds a readout error for this node.

Parameters

readout_error – Error rate of readout, in range [0,1]

add_t1_time(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, time: float) → None¶

Adds a t1 time for this node.

Parameters

time – t1 time of the node in microseconds

add_t2_time(self: pytket.device.GateErrorContainer, time: float) → None¶

Adds a t2 time for this node.

Parameters

time – t2 time of the node in microseconds
